title.narrative: Safeguarding, Access, Dignity and Inclusion Training in Nigeria

description.narrative:
SADI (Safety, Access, Development and Inclusion) is a new corporate priority for CAFOD which improves organisational accountability and response to project participants and CAFOD staff, volunteers and consultants. This is also a strategic way of working to ensure quality of programming and is being rolled out by CAFOD across different country offices. CAFOD in Nigeria intends to work with partners to strengthen their systems, policies and processes including compliance and complaint response handling procedures.
Based on the CAFOD strategy, each country team will be trained as all CAFOD staff are expected to understand the safeguarding commitments. Therefore, in the case of Nigeria, the country team has planned for two sets of engagement. firstly, there will be the 5-day training workshop and then followed up with a 2-day review meeting to evaluate the progress made by the partners.
Furthermore, CAFOD will continue to accompany the partners to meet the standard and improve SADI programming within the next one year.
